explains: adj. 受损的，出毛病的；有（身体或智力）缺陷的
v. 损害，削弱（impair 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.en: They had gravely impaired the credibility of the government.
sentences.cn: 他们已严重地损害了政府的信用。

sentences.en: Much reading has impaired his vision.
sentences.cn: 大量读书损害了他的视力。

sentences.en: Older drivers and visually-or physically-impaired people would gain a new level of freedom.
sentences.cn: 年龄较大的司机和视力或身体受损的人将获得新的自由水平。
